question: Mr. Leo has 24 seeds to plant. If he wants to plant them in 4 equal rows, how many seeds will go in each row?
Mr. Leo has 18 sunflower seeds. If he wants to plant them in 3 rows, how many sunflower seeds will be in each row?
If Mr. Leo has 16 pumpkin seeds and he plants them in 4 rows, how many pumpkin seeds are in each row?
There are 25 bean seeds, and Mr. Leo gives them to 5 students. How many bean seeds does each student receive?
There are 54 tomato seeds and Mr. Leo wants to plant them in 6 rows. How many tomato seeds will be in each row?
If 36 seeds are divided among 9 students, how many seeds does each student get?
Mr. Leo wants to plant 48 cucumber seeds in 6 rows. How many cucumber seeds will be in each row?
If Mr. Leo has 40 radish seeds and divides them among 5 students, how many radish seeds does each student get?
Mr. Leo wants to plant 60 zinnia seeds. If he plants them in 10 equal rows, how many zinnia seeds will be in each row?
There are 64 corn seeds, and Mr. Leo divides them among 8 students. How many corn seeds does each student receive?
